title: Electrostatics - electric potential at two points

content.question: The diagram shows a positively charged particle of charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>. At Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> there is an electric potential <math alttext="V sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>. Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is located twice as far from the charge as Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is, and the electric potential is <math alttext="V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> at this location. Which of the following correctly describe the relationship between <math alttext="V sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub A is greater than V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub A is less than V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub A equals V sub B, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, V sub A equals V sub B, close parenthesis, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub A is greater than V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
